headline: IT’s Wired Backwards
description: A reflection on a circuit that doesn’t work as expected becomes a metaphor for rewiring expectations, embracing reversal, and trusting in learning that unfolds strangely but meaningfully.
timeFelt: An honest reckoning with reversal and hidden alignment. Slightly frustrated, slightly enchanted.
whyItMatters: What began as an error in a beginner circuit turned into a powerful moment of symbolic resonance—the idea that learning can emerge through miswiring, and some errors aren't wrong but differently ordered truths.
articleExcerpt: There was a moment I thought I had broken the board. Nothing responded. It turns out I had wired it backwards. But even backwards, it still showed me something.
sourceFragments: “It lit up, but only when I released the button.”
Exploration of polarity and momentary contact switch behavior.
Realization that backward doesn’t mean broken.
